intro: Solanum bellum, commonly known as the bellflower nightshade, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple in color. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
